DOC.brief_summary: The overall purpose study evaluate intervention aim reduce alcohol-related HIV sexual risk behavior among HIV-negative men Namibia . The objective study determine effectiveness individual counseling intervention reduce alcohol-related HIV sexual risk behavior among men , reduce harmful hazardous alcohol use among men .
DOC.brief_title: Behavioral Counseling Intervention Trial Reduce Alcohol-related Sexual Risk Behavior Among HIV-negative Men Namibia
DOC.detailed_description: This study involve randomize controlled trial 550 HIV-negative adult men recruit single Voluntary Counseling Testing ( VCT ) center HIV Windhoek , Namibia report harmful hazardous alcohol consumption one sex partner previous three month . After receive standard counseling VCT center , men test HIV-negative invite screened eligibility study , eligible , consent enroll . Personnel hire study administer baseline survey via Personal Digital Assistant enrol men . Enrolled participant randomize either intervention arm , receive additional one-hour counseling session take-home material plus general alcohol information material control arm , receive general alcohol information material alone . All men enrol study receive general alcohol information material , consist booklet alcohol health information brochure detail alcohol abuse support service local community . Men intervention arm also receive two cellphone text message one month four month follow enrollment boost risk reduction counsel . Follow-up surveys participant conduct three month six month enrollment Outcomes measure include self-reported data baseline , three month six month post-enrollment regarding : 1 ) Number , proportion sex act precede alcohol use ; 2 ) Number , proportion sex act protect condom ; 3 ) Number sex partner ; 4 ) Quantity frequency alcohol use ; 5 ) Condom use demonstration score .
